intro: Palicourea dolichantha, commonly known as the long-stalked palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. Palicourea dolichantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and undergrowth.
